[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/package-builder/src/lib.rs] [Function: write_to_disk()] [Quote escaping in TOML] Does the format!() properly escape quotes and backslashes in alias addresses and dependency paths to prevent premature string termination in the TOML format? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/package-builder/src/lib.rs] [Function: write_to_temp()] [Predictable temp location] Does tempdir() create directories with unpredictable names, or can an attacker predict the temporary directory location and pre-create symlinks or malicious files there before write_to_temp() is called? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/package-builder/src/lib.rs] [Function: write_to_temp()] [Temp directory cleanup] When the returned TempDir is dropped, does cleanup properly handle cases where files were modified or replaced with symlinks, preventing cleanup failures or symlink-following deletions? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/package-builder/src/lib.rs] [Function: write_to_temp()] [Race condition in temp creation] Between tempdir() creation and write_to_disk() call, can an attacker win a race to modify the temp directory contents or replace it with a symlink to a sensitive location? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/package-builder/src/lib.rs] [Function: write_to_temp()] [Temp permissions leak] Does tempdir() create temporary directories with world-readable permissions, allowing other users on multi-user systems to read sensitive Move source code or configuration during compilation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/package-builder/src/lib.rs] [Function: write_to_temp()] [TempDir lifetime management] If the TempDir is not properly held and gets dropped prematurely, can the temporary directory be cleaned up while still in use, causing compilation failures or allowing directory reuse attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/package-builder/src/lib.rs] [Function: write_to_temp()] [Temp directory exhaustion] Can repeatedly calling write_to_temp() without dropping the TempDir handles cause temporary directory exhaustion, filling up /tmp and causing system-wide issues? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/package-builder/src/lib.rs] [Function: write_to_temp()] [Cross-device temp issues] On systems where /tmp is on a different filesystem than the working directory, can cross-device operations cause failures or security issues in write_to_disk() when given dir.path()? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/package-builder/src/lib.rs] [Struct: PackageBuilder] [Clone safety] Does the Clone trait implementation properly deep-clone all Vec fields (deps, aliases, sources), or can cloned builders share mutable state leading to unexpected modifications? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/package-builder/src/lib.rs] [Struct: PackageBuilder] [Debug trait leak] Does the Debug trait implementation print sensitive information like full source code or dependency paths that could leak in logs or error messages? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/package-builder/src/lib.rs] [Struct: PackageBuilder] [Unbounded Vec growth] Can repeatedly calling add_local_dep(), add_alias(), or add_source() without limits cause unbounded memory growth in the Vec fields, leading to memory exhaustion? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/package-builder/src/lib.rs] [Struct: PackageBuilder] [Builder pattern consistency] Does the builder pattern ensure consistent state, or can calling methods in unexpected orders (e.g., with_policy() after write_to_disk()) cause undefined behavior? (Low)
